data.title: Cumberland County Libraries
data.text:
Featuring

Jamar Nicholas

Jamar Nicholas is an award-winning, Philadelphia-based artist and educator, dedicating his career to helping young people realize the power of visual narrative. Jamar aims to promote anti-bullying, healing, and kindness in his work.

Jamar's current project, partnering with Scholastic Graphix, "Leon the Extraordinary," is the first book in his series featuring Leon and his friends, Carlos and Clementine. His next book, "Leon: Worst Friends Forever," is set to be released October 2024. Learn more about Jamar Nicholas.

In addition to meeting with fans, Jamar will be conducting a workshop for kids and families.

Emma Kaye Cosplay

Bosler is thrilled to have Emma Kaye Cosplay return to host and judge our Cosplay Contest! Emma Kaye Cosplay is a Master Class award winning Cosplayer and Creator. She has been published in multiple Cosplay publications, both for her costumes as well as her writing. Emma is very fond of Disney and Star Wars Characters, but her most recent projects were her Amanita Mushroom Fae and her Post Apocalyptic Poison Ivy. She also enjoys teaching cooking classes at the Kitchen Shoppe of Carlisle and doing Resin work in her spare time.

Emma will also be conducting a "Getting into Cosplay 101" workshop at the event!

WAM! Comics

WAM! Comics is the new imprint of the Charles Bruce Foundation. CBF is a non-profit 501c3 dedicated to supporting Writers, Artists and Musicians WAM!

This years featured artists and authors are Jason Seaux, Micah Davis-Culbertson, Jeremy Ruby, Pat LaMarche, Phil LaMarche and Chad Bruce. Learn more about WAM! Comics.

WAM! Comics will be hosting a discussion and giving a "behind the scenes" look at their newest titles.

Central PA Jedi Sith Alliance

Central PA Jedi Sith Alliance is a not-for-profit, choreographed stage combat club, which specializes in costumed lightsaber demonstrations and performances; and is recognized by Lucasfilm Ltd. LLC as an independent Star Wars fan club. Learn more about the Central PA Jedi Sith Alliance.

Be sure to join us for "The Rise of Darkness" performed by the Central PA Jedi Sith Alliance!

Programming Schedule

Coming Soon!

Special Guests and Vendors

Arch Roommates Independent Comics

Arch Roommates is an independent comic with the premade that a super hero and super villain live in the same apartment but are unaware of each other's identities. This is an independent comic spanning a decade and has been featured in several comic cons locally.

At Your Service Maid Café

We specialize in Fandom inspired treats at conventions! And variety of delicious foods in our shop! Learn more: https://www.aysmaidcafe.com/

Beatrix Ebonmourne

Beatrix Ebonmourne is an illustrator and mural artist based out of Harrisburg, Pennsylvania. She specializes in using mediums both physical and digital to conjure fantasy, scifi, and horror, including her supernatural and fantasy series Jackal and Goat, its sister series, The Hidden Tomes, and Marek: The Bloodied Angel.

Comics and Cool Stuff

Local Carlisle comic book shop. Buying comics, coins, jewelry, videogames, Pokemon, mtg, Star Wars, GI Joe's transformers, tmnt, He-Man, Hot Wheels, Funko pops, spawn, anime, sports, cards, pop culture memorabilia, Legos, vintage toys, slot cars, records, sterling silver, action figures, skateboards, and guitars.

Fraeoffice LLC

An artist that combines modern and retro art in a bold and stylish way. Learn more: https://fraeofficial.com/

Geek Renaissance

Local, small business, making magical merchandise for fans, geeks, & fun! Everything from keychains & jewelry, to wreaths, dominoes & candle holders. Custom orders always welcome! Find us all over social media for behind the scenes fangirling. Learn more: https://geekrenaissance.myshopify.com/

George Cole

Collector of comic books, drawings, prints, figures, hero clix, funko pops, sports cards, t-shirts, and books.

Green Man Cosplay

Bill Schmidt of Green Man Cosplay is a Master Class Award winning Cosplayer, who is been published for his Costumes in multiple Cosplay publications. He loves cosplaying primarily green characters such as the Riddler, Green Goblin, and the Grinch, as well as other hued individuals like Batman. Bill is always willing to help where he can and enjoys doing charitable events for his community.

Jason Seaux

An independent comic artist who’s worked for God-Awful Comics, Paranoia Comics, and WAM comics.

Jason Sitlinger

3D printing, perlar beads, keychains and other art.

Jeremy Ruby (LoudMind Studios)

Ruby is a multifaceted artist known for his prowess in comic art, tattooing, and diverse creative mediums. With a passion for visual storytelling, Jeremy's distinctive style breathes life into characters and narratives, captivating audiences. Learn more: loudmindstudios.com

Julie Mell

Perler beads crafted into retro-chic pixelated wearables, jewelry, home decor and more! Including comic, cartoon, and anime characters.

Otherword Prints and Crafts

I create and sell pixel art made out of plastic colored beads to be hung on the wall also make trinket boxes and character with stands.

Ram Khatri

Hi there, I'm Ram Khatri. You might recognize me as the one who brought Franz Kafka's 'The Metamorphosis' to life in Nepali. Over the years, I've worn many hats – from managing editor to publishing manager – in the vibrant world of US publishing. Originally from Nepal, I pursued my passion for literature with an M.A. from Tribhuwan University, Kathmandu, and an M.S. from Pace University, New York. I'm all about stories that speak to the soul, especially those that champion diversity and underrepresented voices. Outside of work, I love immersing myself in conversations with people from all walks of life.

retroGAG

A booth mainly focused around nostalgia and all things for nerds! I upcycle jewelry from vintage toys and more so we can wear a piece of our childhood. I make earrings, chokers and more and also sell my artwork in pins and keychains for various fandoms. I also cosplay and sell cosplay prints.

Riley Haring

Riley Haring is an illustrator specializing in concept art, comic art, and character design. He grew up in his parents' bookstore, developing a deep love for all things fantasy. He has illustrated two children’s books for that bookstore, the Cupboard Maker Books, and has worked as a freelance illustrator for five plus years. He has also self-published a handful of character design zines as well as a collaborative fantasy comic series, Barkeep.
